column1: Kuduk (pl. *Kudugin) was the actual Westron word with which the Hobbitss called themselves. It is translated as "Hobbit."
It is suggested that this developed from an older word
column3: meaning holbytlan. Although the Hobbits called themselves kuduk
column4: they had forgotten the meaning of the word.

column2: J.R.R. Tolkien considered the form c没buc pl. c没bugin which was apparently dropped later.
